intro: Microsteris gilioides, commonly known as the Gili Island microsteris, is a rare flowering plant native to the Gili Islands in Indonesia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, thriving in sandy soils and saline environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
